page.title: 10Hook Women's Institute
page.content: Hook Womens Institute was formed on 11th November 1954.It has 67 members today.The meetings are held in Hook Memorial Hall on the Second Monday of the month.The ladies meet at 7.15pm to hear various speakers on diverse subjects such as 'Cooking by Microwave ','Farming Today','The Jewish Family' and 'Collecting Antiques'.The evenings end with tea and biscuits.Outings to the theatre or places of historical interest arranged.The annual member ship fee is Â£4.The institute is run by an elected committee of twelve. There is a Chairman and a Secretary. Each Institue belongs to a group of seven or eight W.I's and each group belongs to Federation.Hook belongs to the Howden Group along with Bubwith, Barmby,Laxton,Marshland,Skelton and Sandholme.The Howden Group belongs to the East Yorkshire Federation.
